citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The two Bengal cats, "Big Mac" (2-year-old male) and "Coco" (3-year-old female) had loose stool noted on the inspection
conducted on 24-JUL-2023. However, these animals still have not been examined by a veterinarian as required. Changes
in the consistency of stool may indicate several medical conditions related to parasites, diet, stress, or more serious
issues. The licensee must have the animals examined by a veterinarian to determine an appropriate plan for diagnosis
and treatment.

Several overflowing garbage receptacles were noted in the laundry room where animal food was stored. The sink was
also filled with utensils waiting to be cleaned. In addition, numerous soiled litter boxes awaiting cleaning were found
stacked in another room. Animal areas must be kept neat and free of any accumulation of trash, waste material, or other
discarded materials. These attract rodents, insects and other pests, and contribute to odor.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The two Bengal cats, "Big Mac" (2-year-old male) and "Coco" (3-year-old female) had loose stool noted on the inspection 
conducted on 24-JUL-2023. However, these animals still have not been examined by a veterinarian as required. Changes 
in the consistency of stool may indicate several medical conditions related to parasites, diet, stress, or more serious 
issues. The licensee must have the animals examined by a veterinarian to determine an appropriate plan for diagnosis 
and treatment. 
3.1(b)  Repeat
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Several overflowing garbage receptacles were noted in the laundry room where animal food was stored. The sink was 
also filled with utensils waiting to be cleaned. In addition, numerous soiled litter boxes awaiting cleaning were found 
stacked in another room. Animal areas must be kept neat and free of any accumulation of trash, waste material, or other 
discarded materials. These attract rodents, insects and other pests, and contribute to odor. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
 n
